newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia Opp'n calls for further rate cut.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia Opp'n calls for further rate cut.

text.p: Australian opposition leader Kim Beazley said on Tuesday the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) should cut interest rates further, offsetting the effects of a high Australian dollar.

"I think they (RBA) should have done a one percent cut when they last addressed this issue (in November), and I think they should have addressed both the cuts earlier than they did," Beazley told reporters.
"I would hope that the Reserve Bank would see its way clear to correct that," he said.
Beazley said the rising Australian dollar indicated there was a need to bring interest rates down early, boosting a basically strong economy.
The Australian dollar reached six year highs on Monday, reaching US$0.8198/03 at 5.00 p.m. (0600 GMT).
The bank's policy-setting board is meeting today.
Some commentators have predicted a monetary easing on Wednesday, although most expect the bank to hold off on any cut until the new year.
The bank cut its target for overnight cash rates by half a percentage point in both July and November, taking it to 6.5 percent in response to lower inflation and moderate wages growth.
